intro: Jacaranda hebephora, commonly known as the pink jacaranda, is a deciduous tree native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking clusters of pale pink to lilac flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The tree has pinnate leaves composed of 10–20 elliptical leaflets, and its bark is smooth and greyish in color. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a popular ornamental plant in warmer climates. The flowers are not only aesthetically pleasing but also attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
